transportAdvice: Fukuoka has an efficient subway system and extensive bus network that connect major tourist areas, making public transit the most practical way to get around; taxis are widely available but more expensive. The city center and popular districts like Tenjin and Hakata are walkable, though the subway is recommended for reaching attractions further afield.

weather.description: Cool and crisp winter weather with occasional rain; light to mid-layer clothing is recommended.
Still cold with a gradual warming trend; occasional rain and rare light snow possible.
Early spring brings mild temperatures and cherry blossom season begins toward month's end.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming flowers; one of the most popular times to visit.
Warm and comfortable with increasing humidity; light layers are sufficient for most days.
Rainy season begins with frequent heavy showers and rising humidity; a compact umbrella is essential.
Hot and very humid with heavy rainfall early in the month; the famous Hakata Gion Yamakasa festival takes place this month.
Peak summer heat with intense humidity; typhoon risk increases and outdoor sightseeing is best done in the morning.
Still warm and humid with the highest typhoon risk of the year; rain can be heavy and prolonged.
Comfortable autumn temperatures with lower humidity; excellent conditions for sightseeing and outdoor dining.
Cool and pleasant with autumn foliage; one of the best months to visit for comfortable weather.
Cold winter weather sets in with occasional rain; festive illuminations brighten the city in the evenings.
